Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay”
Reviews.Author: Stoltinger
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2nights during a business trip and left with a very negative impression. Even the price is low I rather pay a bit more and have a good rest, find motivated staff, get some amaneties, find a TV that works and a clean environment. All this though I missed when being here. Will avoid this hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Lumyde
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel because the rate was 50 euros per night and the pictures looked decent. I dint want an expensive one as i was only staying for 2 days. I was a bit doubtful about how it would turn out because of the mixed reviews from previous guests. It ended up to be much better than what I expected. The airport is about 10-15 mins away. The only negetive about the location is that it's around 15 mins from the centre. You can take a bus right in front of the hotel and the metro station is a 5 min walk away. The hotel is extremely clean and the rooms are spacious and well-kept. The buffet breakfast served was great, had a lot of variety and it only costs 5 euros. The staff is very friendly and helpful. There aren't many people working in the hotel but they seem to manage it well. My family and I had a lovely stay at this hotel and would definitely stay here again when we go back to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Tenglish09
Reviews.Content: Instead of staying in the airport overnight my boyfriend and I found a great deal on Hotwire.com and stayed for one night. We arrived at the hotel before our check in time but were told that we could check in since the room was ready. The room was perfect for the two of us and also had a balcony which was really nice. The balcony was basic but we had no idea we would be getting one in the first place. Diego helped us most of the time we were there and also made sure to call a taxi for us to get to the airport in the morning. It cost us €21 to get to Barajas airport and the taxi driver was waiting for us in the lobby (we were even early). Also there is free internet which was easy to access. The only things I didn't like was the guy who worked in the dining area. He may have been the only one doing the whole thing (making the food, taking orders, serving, & cleaning up) but he was a bit short and nasty to us. Also, the metro wasn't too far, but it would have been nice if it were closer. Maybe took about 10-15 minutes. The hotel is very modern and clean. There are also smoking or non-smoking rooms available.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Shai A
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located 20 minutes by bus / Metro from city center and offers very good services: Great , comfy rooms, a nice breakfast, very good and fasy service by all empolyees we stumbled by. They fixed the safe deposit box within minutes, printed out some material we needed by minutes, were very kind, polite and helpful explaining everything to us. The beds matreses are Visco quality I think, which is rare to find in hotels... In short - definitely consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: AdriftUSA
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, comfortable, and fairly spacious, with nice bathrooms. To counter what someone else said, the room I stayed in did have a hairdryer, so perhaps that issue was solved? The TVs are very very small and have very very few channels. Wifi was supposed to work, but trust me, it never did. The neighborhood seemed safe, definitely not the heart of madrid, but a short walk to the metro nonetheless - although it is uphill. The walls are fairly thin and you can hear almost everything next door/above.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel for business trips, desolate area of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Marina L
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at Confortel Alcalá Norte, on a business trip to a client nearby. The room was spacious and very comfortable, the bathroom also very good. Buffet breakfast was OK, there wasn't any yogurt and fruit was also not in the largest of supplies, average I'd say. Something strange is that being a 4-star the only amenities provided were a small piece of soap and two small vials of shampoo, so if you want to wash your hands and use in the shower you have to use the same soap. Also, they don't replenish the amenities when they clean the room. Free water bottles are provided in the mini bar (the only content), but not replenished during the stay. The area is quite deserted at night with very few options for dinner, and the restaurant cafeteria is, well, short of miserable, serving salads, sandwiches, burguers or pizzas.

Reviews.Title: “Do not use this hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: steve w
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not have irons or hairdryers in the room, nor do they have an ironing room. The only thing they offer is a chargeable laundry service. The rooms are OK but the facilities are sparse.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Njdt
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it offered a free shuttle on expedia and breakfast. We got here to find neither one of those to be true! We spent 25euro on a taxi from the airport! The hotel is 3 stars tops. it's clean but very bare bones. The first room we were in sounded like there were drums beating when we turned the air on so we moved rooms. Not a good value once you add the taxi costs when there are plenty of hotels with free shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Just what was needed”
Reviews.Author: Pat A
Reviews.Content: Room was spacious and very comfortable. Free internet usage was a bonus. Food was excellent value for money. Not far from the Metro, there are a couple of useful shops nearby and a couple of restaurants which was really handy. Could do with adding a couple more English channels to the satellite selection e.g. movie and entertainment. A very relaxing week.

Reviews.Title: “Care of the Guest this hotel's true priority”
Reviews.Author: DHIIPAK
Reviews.Content: This can probably be called an "airport hotel" given the proximity to Madrid's Barajas international airport---which is what I chose it for laying over a night before a long flight home to California. The property seems pretty new, 4-*** and well maintained. It also appears to market small conference meetings also. As the final test of any hotel--it gave an excellent night's sleep with quiet rooms and comfortable beds -- just what I needed before my next day's 30-hour odyssey to reach the west coast of the US !. One problem with Madrid's airport district is the pretty fair distance from the city center. Taxi fare will be about 20 to 25 euros to get to many "airport hotels" like this one (a metro is possible with one transfer stop in between which could be inconvenient if you're hauling major luggage). One way to save is on trips to the airport if you could find other guests going there too and split the cab fare with them. The complementary Wi-Fi was fine which was a help and the price (relatively speaking for Madrid) was a good offer via www.hotels.com The BEST thing about my stay was the incredible guest service given by Ms. Cinta Correa Castano, Reception Manager. She very efficiently recovered a wrist watch I forgot in my room in an anxious rush to get to the airport. When I realized my error and called from my departure gate before boarding the staff swept my room, found my watch--and then she arranged to get it to my Spanish residence within 24 hours via mensenger service. The watch has high sentimental value and would be hard to buy again---and she treated my concern like her own in coming to my assistance. BRAVO !!

Reviews.Title: “Wow- far away but pretty good in so many ways.... muy decente.”
Reviews.Author: Fattycrab
Reviews.Content: There are always surprises. I got this as a result of Priceline and I was freaked out when I looked at its location and more freaked when I tried to find one cold December evening. The walk from the Suanzes Metro stop was dicey to say the least in that it was a brisk fifteen minute walk to the metro station on the number 5 line. When I finaly arrived, I was pleased that the huge bunker of a hotel had large rooms and a super duper large bathroom. The staff is really competent and not only that, they are down to earth yet very professional. The walk to the metro was ususally long, past showrooms and a gas station BUT I soon learned another way. If one gets off the metro at Ciudad Lineal and waits for the 105 bus which runs on Julian Camarillo, one can skip the walk altogether and arrive after the bus makes a left turn on San Romualdo. The breakfasts in the restaurant are a great deal on the weekends if they are having a special discount. Otherwise, the food is just alright. The free and very swift wifi is a great feature in the hotel that other properties, even those which are more pricey would be wise to emulate. When weeks later I was stuck without wifi because another nearby hotel had no connection to the internet ( right? ) the staff here was nice enough to remember me and let me use the two free pcs in the lobby. Very nice. The only drawback besides the remoteness is the lack of a gym. the building is huge thing and though there is parking, no gym? I guess they are hoping people will walk to the metro. Nearby there is a park to run but I did not try it. I would later try another Confortel in the Madrid area and was disappointed after staying at the Confortel Alcala Norte. The rooms are huge for Madrid and I think that one could do worse by booking a hotel in Madrid, centrally located or not, and not giving the Confortel Alcala a chance. One just should get used to a little hike.

Reviews.Title: “Good but far away”
Reviews.Author: Passenger86
Reviews.Content: I stayed there only two nights on Christmas. I was lookig for something cheap, not necessary close to the city centre. The room was good, the staff very kind and the property very quiet wich is important I think, specially in Christmas time when everything outside is crowded and noisy. I'm very happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern business hotel”
Reviews.Author: tacotaco
Reviews.Content: New, modern and clean. There are only two English channels on the telly, and both are 24-hour news channels.

Reviews.Title: “quite nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mickeymlai
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cool, in a sense that it is clean and nice. I went with my bf and we only have a tiny suitcase (handcarry one) so walking to and form the station to the hotel its ok. Althought it include some going up the slope ..but it is afforable. Or even if you have got one of the day passes, you can take the bus adjecent to the hotel and you can dump off the next stop this takes you closer to the metro station. The most beautiful thing about this hotel is the free minibar, you know how expensive drinks could be, and they are giving out all of those for free. So everynight we would get some food in and enjoy the lay in... Staff are friendly and air con work perfectly fine. Area is not that amazing and it is about 12 stops from the central, i think it is about half an hour metro from central. or 5 stops from the bull fight (ventas) area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but far from the centre”
Reviews.Author: just-another-TA
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Madrid. We stayed here for 7 nights and so also hired a car to travel so we went to Valencia for a day. However, this was a relaxing holiday so alot more of our time was spent in the hotel than we otherwise have done elsewhere. The hotel itself is really nice and decorated modern. The free minibar and refill service is great in the room as I've not witnessed this in any other hotel to date. Parking at the hotel was however expensive 24Euros per day which was a slight disappointment but wireless internet was free. The hotel food was not very nice and the pizza company they use also did not meet expectations. The hotel was very far from central madrid, but fortunately for us, we hired the car, but I'm unsure as to how easy it would be to travel into the centre via the train/underground service. All in all, a great hotel, location is probably the main downside for sightsee-ers- (although I thinks its primarily a business hotel so not so bad then)

Reviews.Title: “Smart comfortable hotel, 15 mins from airport”
Reviews.Author: CurranShelter
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel mainly because of its location – within easy reach of the airport but not too far out of the city. It is a good 10-15 minute walk to the nearest metro (Suanzes), but it’s easy to find, feels reasonably safe at night (it’s a commercial area, well-lit and fairly quiet), and the connections are good. We had to take a taxi to the airport (booked by the hotel) as our flight was early in the morning – the journey took about ten minutes (but allow 15 – you might not get the Alonso-style driver we had!) and cost just under 20 euros (seems quite a lot but you have to pay an airport surcharge for some reason). NB: it may not be as close to the airport as some hotels, but beware, stay too close to the airport and apparently you may have trouble finding a taxi driver who is interested in taking you such a short distance. The hotel itself is very modern and has good soundproofing, and even the standard rooms have a minibar (small chiller with soft drinks and beer, included in room price and replenished daily!) and WiFi, along with satellite TV, air conditioning (quiet and effective), large bathrooms with good showers and comfortable beds (plus a choice of pillows, according to the Confortel leaflet). For those without laptops (it’s primarily a business-orientated hotel – no real leisure amenities), there are two internet terminals near the lobby (no charge). We found the staff to be friendly, and we just had two fairly trivial causes for complaint - a blown lightbulb that wasn’t replaced (even when we left it out – it was just taken away!) and the wake-up call being a bit late (but only 5 mins. or so). Breakfast (if not included in your room rate) costs 15 euros, and I think they serve other meals too, but we chose to eat elsewhere. I managed to find a room-only rate of about £41 (about 61 euros) per night through the UK agent Travel Republic, which seemed very reasonable indeed. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Is a little walk no problem? Walk to the Alcala Norte”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated 7 km north east of Madrid centre. Metro stop Suanzes. You have to walk 10-15 minutes to the hotel. 4-star. It's a hotel where business people are the majority off the clients. But travelers ? Yes. Is a little walk no problem? Walk to this hotel. New, clean, friendly polite staff, good equipment, rooms are splendid. Quiet !! Internet connection in your room. Free use of minibar. Breakfast is great. Just a good hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Confortel Alcala Norte
HotelInfo.Address: Calle San Romualdo 30, 28037 Madrid, Spain
